description.narrative: The Government of Angola has increased national capacity to implement and monitor sustainable WASH services

sector.narrative: Community and home based maternal and newborn care
Hygiene - handwashing with soap in communities

description.narrative: Water supply and Sanitation policy, planning and administration
Water supply and Sanitation rural sanitation

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: The Government of Angola has increased national capacity to implement and monitor sustainable WASH services

description.narrative:
National Water, Sanitation and Hygiene (WASH) Sector Coordination Platform (FONAS, in Portuguese) designed and launched in 2019 by the Ministry of Energy and Water (MINEA) and Ministry of Environment (MINAMB), with the technical and financial support from UNICEF.
National Strategy on Community-Led Total Sanitation and Schools for Angola, to ending open defecation by 2030 in the country, designed with the technical and financial support from UNICEF, approved by the Council of Ministers (Government of Angola) in 2019. | Status:Met | As-of Date:13/12/2019

title.narrative: Number of communities certified free of open defecation in the reporting year only as a result of UNICEF direct support
National strategy to eliminate open defecation available with a systemic approach to gender
(NOT VALID after Dec 31 2017) ) Existing sustainability compact or sustainability plan with evidence of continous monitoring

actual.value: 2019:The National WASH Sector Coordination Forum (FONAS in Portuguese) desigend, approved and launched.

title.narrative: National monitoring systems reporting on equity of access to WASH services available

actual.value: 2019:National Management Information System (MIS) for WASH (SISAS in Portuguese) still under development.

title.narrative: Existence of functioning sector coordination mechanism for water, sanitation and hygiene

actual.value: 2019:National WASH sector Cordination Platform (FONAS) designed, approved by the Government, and recently officially launched (Nov. 28th).
